description: All Government bodies in Eritrea will issue and observe detailed guidelines to implement all measures taken to-date in their respective institutions.

description: Authorities in Eritrea ordered the closure of all educational institutions across the country as of March 27, 2020. The ministry said the new lockdown measures will remain effective until further notice.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that members of a household, not exceeding two at a time, are allowed to go out from their homes to buy essential food items during the day. This conditional permission also holds for emergency medical treatment. With the exception of citizens employed in institutions that will continue their functions, all other individuals confined to their homes are not allowed to use their private cars during this period.
The Ministry of Health of Eritrea urges all nationals and foreigners who may have plans to travel to, and from Eritrea, to postpone their plans.
The government of Eritrea has urged people not to travel to or from the country, and will be quarantining any incoming travellers who have recently been in China, Italy, South Korea, or Iran.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All Eritrean nationals living abroad are urged to take all necessary precautionary measures for their own safety, the safety of their families as well as the Eritrean communities.  They should also refrain from travelling to Eritrea.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all commercial passenger flights to and from Eritrea will not be allowed from midnight today, (25 March 2020). The ban will remain effective for two weeks until further review.
Commercial flights in Eritrea banned.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all commercial passenger flights to and from Eritrea will not be allowed from midnight today, (25 March 2020). The ban will remain effective for two weeks until further review. UPDATE: All commercial passenger flights to and from Eritrea were stopped from 25th March onwards for a duration of two weeks, this was later extended for 21 days from 1st April onwards but is still in place until further notice.

Flights to and from Eritrea have been stopped since the outbreak of COVID-19. Until the necessary comprehensive review and appraisal is finalized, the Guidelines in force for the last two months will be eased incrementally.
link: NA ; shabait.com/news/local-news/30650-guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19 ; Ministry of Information ; Guidelines from the High Level Task Force on COVID-19

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that the prior degree is recalled that all passenger flights to and from the country were banned for two weeks. This is extended now in accordance with Article 11 of the guidelines of the High Level Task Force on COVID-19 Article 1, which ‘supplements’ and ‘supersedes’ all previous measures and is effective for 21 days from 1st April onwards.

All passengers who were in the same flight with the 3 people tested positive for corona virus in Eritrea and all those who came in physical contact with them have been quarantined and are being monitored closely by health officials in charge.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The ruler of Eritrea, Isaias Afeworki, has refused the COVID-19 supplies donated by the Chinese billionaire Jack Ma and his Alibaba Group. The plane carrying the goods was not authorized to land in Eritrea and returned to where it came without delivering the intended goods

The Government of Eritrea has decided for the launching of random and extensive testing to gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country in a comprehensive and more reliable manner, starting from the 16th of May onwards.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should refrain from internal as well as foreign travel unless this is for extremely urgent and unavoidable purposes from the 16th March 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should refrain from internal as well as foreign travel unless this is for extremely urgent and unavoidable purposes from the 16th March 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should avoid non-essential movement within the city or village of residence as well as travel to other places inside the country. Every person should likewise avoid travel by bus, mini-bus and taxis unless in emergencies from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all public transport vehicles - buses, minibuses and taxis – in all the cities will stop services from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, March 27th.  Use of trucks for public transport is illicit and punishable by law. With the exception of those who may be granted special permit by the competent authority in urgent circumstances, all public transport services from one Region to another, or from one city to another, will likewise be stopped from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, 27 March 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All public transport vehicles – buses, minibuses and taxis – in all the cities will stop services from 6:00 a.m , March 27th.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Eritrea is enforcing a stay at home order on all its citizens and no citizens in the country. This will be till further notice.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that stringent legal measures will be taken on all individuals and commercial enterprises that engage in hoarding and speculative price hikes by misconstruing the precautionary measures that are being taken to safeguard the safety of the Eritrean people and the country from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.
type_text: The policy announces that legal measures will be taken against all individuals and commercial enterprises that engage in hoarding and speculative price hikes by misconstruing the precautionary measures.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that payment of electricity, water and telephone household bills will be postponed from 30th March 2020 onwards.
type_text: Payment of electricity, water and telephone household bills will be postponed.

description: Rights groups call on government to release detainees amid fears of a coronavirus outbreak.
type_text: Rights groups call on government to release other detainees amid fears of a coronavirus outbreak.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Diaspora contributions pouring in Eritrea in attempt to fight the Covid 19.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that continuous sensitization campaigns will be disseminated through the various local media outlets in order to provide timely and full information to the general public. These announcements must be followed with due diligence.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announced on the 11th March 2020 that all visitors who originate directly from, or who have transited through, China, Italy, South Korea and Iran will be quarantined.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that bars, restaurants, cafés and other service outlets that cater to sizeable clients will be closed for 14 days from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, 31st March 2020. All employees of these enterprises will not be laid off and their full salary for  the period in question will be borne by the employer.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all trading activities and transactions will be banned in this period (21 days). Similarly, weekly markets that occur in various parts of the country will remain closed.  Food production, supply and processing enterprises as well as grocery stores, pharmacies and banks will however continue to provide services. These institutions will close at 8:00 pm every evening. Major productive and service sectors (manufacturing, food processing, construction, Trucking etc.) will continue their functions. Citizens in the rural areas engaged in farming and animal husbandry will continue to engage in their vital developmental tasks. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions, from 2nd April 2020 onwards.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all court sessions – at all levels – will be postponed until further notice, from 30th March 2020 onwards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all Government Institutions will stop routine services and functions to focus on indispensable developmental and security tasks. Majority of public sector employees will thus stay at home. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions from the 2nd April 2020 onwards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces, that all public gatherings, sport and cultural events that assemble a crowd of more than 10 people are prohibited. Cinemas and night-clubs will remain closed until further notice from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that aggregation of more than 10 people at social events (funerals, weddings, mourning, baptism and other gatherings) is banned. Every citizen must observe, and same instruction is being given by religious leaders to the faithful, prayers and associated religious sermons in their homes from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.
The Ministry of Health of Eritrea urges every person to avoid, in as much as this is possible, public gatherings from the 16th March 2020 onwards.
The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces to all citizens and foreigners residing in the country that social distancing must be heeded to in other commercial units and centers.
